title: What we know about BA.2 -- now the dominant cause of Covid-19 in the US
description: The highly contagious Omicron subvariant BA.2 is now the dominant strain of Covid-19 in the United States, causing an estimated 54.9% of all new Covid-19 infections last week, according to new data from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: Trump brazenly asks Putin to release dirt about Biden's family
description: In a new interview published Tuesday, former President Donald Trump called on Russian President Vladimir Putin to release any damaging information he has about the Biden family, in a brazen request for domestic political assistance from America's top adversary.

title: Analysis: Americans are so over Covid-19
description: Covid-19 may not be done with us. But we sure as heck are done with it.

title: Biden to sign bill making lynching a federal hate crime into law
description: President Joe Biden on Tuesday is set to sign into law a bill that would make lynching a federal hate crime after Congress approved the legislation earlier this month with overwhelming bipartisan support.

title: At least 5 dead in shooting near Tel Aviv
description: Five people were killed in a shooting near Tel Aviv, according to Israeli police, marking the third such attack in Israel within a week.

title: US skeptical of Russian claims it's scaling back the war in Ukraine
description: President Joe Biden and other American officials voiced extreme caution Tuesday at signals Russia is scaling back its military operations near Kyiv, suggesting they were waiting to see stronger signs of de-escalation before making an assessment of Moscow's intentions.

title: Intriguing discovery on Pluto hints at the possibility of life
description: Images of Pluto captured by NASA's New Horizons mission have revealed a new surprise: ice volcanoes.

title: Oil prices fall sharply, briefly dipping below $100 a barrel
description: Oil prices fell sharply on Tuesday after Russia indicated it will dial back its assault in parts of Ukraine.

title: What Apple's surging stock says about the market
description: One month ago, when Russia's war in Ukraine erupted, fearful investors yanked their money out of riskier bets and sought safer places to park their cash. Now, in the final days of a turbulent quarter, there are signs that confidence is returning.

title: US general says there 'could be' an intelligence gap that caused US to overestimate Russia's capabilities
description: The top US general in Europe said Tuesday there "could be" a gap in US intelligence gathering that caused the US to overestimate Russia's capability and underestimate Ukraine's defensive abilities before Russia attacked Ukraine.

title: 70-year-old who kidnapped a bus full of children and buried them alive given parole
description: A 70-year-old man imprisoned for the 1976 kidnapping of a bus full of children has been approved for parole, according to spokesperson Joe Orlando of the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation (CDCR).

title: Web3 promises to put the internet into the hands of the people. Don't believe the hype
description: Similar to "the internet" or "cryptocurrency" in their infancy, the term "Web3" has entered the public discourse before being widely understood. However, Web3 might be the haziest and most vague of the bunch.

title: Reports: White House records of January 6 show more than seven-hour gap in Trump's calls
The great resignation continues: 4.4 million Americans quit their jobs last month
description: The worker shortage has been a hallmark of the pandemic economy -- and it's far from getting resolved. In February, US businesses had 11.3 million job openings to fill, slightly more than economists had predicted.

title: 'Frozen in time': Rescued film near Chernobyl shows life before the nuclear disaster
description: Thirty years after families in northern Ukraine were forced to abandon their homes following the Chernobyl nuclear disaster in 1986, photographer Maxim Dondyuk began collecting their things.

title: Mick Schumacher's crash at Saudi Arabian Grand Prix could cost Haas $1 million
description: Mick Schumacher's crash during qualifying at the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix could cost Haas as much as $1 million to repair the car.

title: Russia-Ukraine talks offer roadmap to a truce -- but one that passes through a minefield
description: When the Russian and Ukrainian foreign ministers met in Turkey just 19 days ago, the atmosphere was toxic -- and neither side got far beyond restating existing positions.

title: Canadian gymnasts allege 'abuse, neglect and discrimination' within the sport
description: More than 70 former and current gymnasts in Canada have called for an investigation into "ongoing toxic and abusive practices" gymnasts are allegedly subject to in the country.

title: Jada Pinkett Smith posts about 'healing' amid Oscars controversy
How an Oscars photographer captured the moment Will Smith slapped Chris Rock
description: Will Smith striking Chris Rock at Sunday's Academy Awards will go down as one of the most shocking moments in Oscars history. And Brian Snyder was there to document it.

title: Pentagon tells CNN Russia has stopped advancing towards Kyiv
description: Puck Washington correspondent Julia Ioffe and former US ambassador to Ukraine William Taylor react to reports that Russian forces have pulled back from two Ukrainian cities.

title: Queen Elizabeth attends late husband's memorial service
description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth made her first public appearance in five months on Tuesday when she joined the royal family and other dignitaries at a memorial service in honor of her husband Prince Philip, who died last year.

title: Correspondent details what happens if you test positive for Covid-19 in Shanghai
description: CNN's David Culver gives us a look into what it's like in Shanghai, China, amidst the countries biggest lockdown since the beginning of the pandemic. For more from "CNN Go There," subscribe to CNN+.

title: US is welcoming Ukrainian refugees, but turning away others seeking safety
description: Groups of Ukrainian families at the US-Mexico border are getting the chance to do something most asylum-seeking migrants haven't been allowed to do for years: cross legally into the United States.

title: Ukraine's Azov brigade is repelling Russians in Mariupol. Here's why that's controversial
description: President Vladimir Putin framed the Russian invasion of Ukraine as a "special mission" to protect Russian speakers from genocide at the hands of ​"neo-Nazis."

title: Radiation exposure drug maker says it is ramping up supply in Europe
description: Russia's refusal to rule out nuclear war has put the world in an unsettling reality: The unthinkable is suddenly a possibility -- if extremely remote. One drugmaker, Partner Therapeutics, isn't waiting to take action.

title: Donald Trump told the world about his hole-in-one in the Trumpiest way possible
description: Over the weekend, a photo of Donald Trump after he purportedly shot a hole-in-one circulated around the Internet. On Monday night, the former President put those rumors to rest in the most Trump-y way possible.

title: US intel assess 'major' strategy shift by Russia as it moves some forces away from Kyiv
description: Russia is beginning to withdraw some forces from the area around the Ukrainian capital city of Kyiv in what the US assesses as a major strategy shift by Moscow, two senior US officials tell CNN.

title: Barclays hit by $590 million US market blunder and stake sale
description: Shares in Barclays fell as much as 6% in early trading on Tuesday, after one of its top investors offloaded stock roughly equivalent to a 3% stake in the lender.

title: Jason Momoa dashes hopes of Lisa Bonet reconciliation
description: Despite speculation to the contrary, Jason Momoa says he has not reunited with Lisa Bonet.

title: Will Smith's mother and siblings respond to confrontation at the Oscars
description: CNN affiliate Philadelphia's WPVI has the exclusive interview with Will Smith's mother, Carolyn Smith, who shares her excitement and pride after her son, Will Smith, wins his first Oscar. Carolyn Smith and Will's sisters all share the same surprise at the slap and the mother stated that was the first time she has ever seen him "go off."

title: Will Russia use its gas to 'blackmail' Europe? We're about to find out
description: In the weeks since Russia invaded Ukraine, Moscow has continued to ship natural gas westward and Europe has used the energy to power industry and heat homes. That may be about to change.

title: They tried to reveal what life was like under Russian occupation. Then they disappeared
After two years, the final US military medical Covid-19 deployments are ending: 'We still have a long road ahead'
description: First, it was a smaller hospital with fewer than 200 beds in Farmington, New Mexico, where the high desert borders the Navajo Nation. Then, it was a massive university hospital in bustling Salt Lake City, Utah, with about 800 staffed beds.

title: Why Turkish food is among the world's best
description: Turkey may be famous for its kebabs, but the popular dish is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to Turkish cuisine.

title: In Russia's neighboring country, women learn self-defense
description: Hundreds of women in the Baltic country of Estonia next to Russia are learning about weapons, first aid and survival tactics, to ensure they are ready for any possible threat from their neighbor. CNN's Lynda Kinkade reports.

title: Will Smith issues apology to Chris Rock over Oscars slapping incident
description: • Will Smith and Chris Rock have a history

title: Starbucks needs a better leadership plan than Howard Schultz
description: On the morning of its annual meeting earlier this month, Starbucks made a surprising announcement. After a five-year break, the coffee chain's founder Howard Schultz will return as CEO in April, filling the position for the third time.

title: Belgian footballer Miguel Van Damme dies at 28
description: Belgian footballer Miguel Van Damme has died from leukemia, leaving behind his wife and young daughter, his club Cercle Brugge said Tuesday. He was 28 years old.

title: Police to issue 20 fines in UK's 'Partygate' scandal
description: UK police will issue 20 fines for breaches of Covid-19 laws after revelations of a series of parties held at Downing Street while rest of the country was living under strict pandemic lockdowns.

title: See how family reacted when returning to home destroyed by Russians
description: Citizens of Mariupol, Ukraine, are returning to their homes to see what is left after attacks from Russia devastated their city.

title: Biden's double standard on refugees
description: Over the weekend President Joe Biden met in Poland with a group of Ukrainian refugees whom he lauded as "an amazing group of people." But where was Biden when it came to the Afghan refugees fleeing the rule of the Taliban this past summer?

title: Can this Middle East island nation become a tourist hotspot?
description: Bahrain has long relied on its fossil fuel reserves, but with oil running out, the island nation is looking to diversify its economy. Now, it's hoping a $427 million waterfront development project will help it catch up with more popular tourist destinations in the Gulf and establish the country as a beach-holiday hotspot.

title: More missiles: US to boost production of Stingers and Javelins
description: The Defense Department plans to accelerate production of Stinger anti-aircraft missiles and Javelin anti-tank missiles so it can refill its own depleted stocks as it continues to send the vital systems to Ukrainian forces fighting the Russian invasion, according to defense officials.

title: Soccer star returns to play on pitch where he almost died
description: Christian Eriksen is set to make an emotional return to Parken Stadium on Tuesday, just over nine months on from suffering a cardiac arrest on the very same pitch.

title: Ben & Jerry's flavor uses alcohol made from cheese waste
description: The world loves cheese: last year, more than 21 million metric tons of it were produced globally. But to make cheese, you end up with a lot of whey, and that can be a problem.

title: Why Turkey is in a unique position to mediate
description: As Russian and Ukrainian delegations arrive Tuesday in Istanbul for peace talks, Turkey's unique political position is under the spotlight. Could the nation that straddles Europe and the Middle East emerge as peacemaker?

title: Singapore rejects intellectually disabled man's final appeal against execution for drug smuggling
description: A Singapore court on Tuesday rejected a final appeal by a man sentenced to death for drug trafficking, following a campaign by his lawyers who said the trial violated international laws as the man has intellectual disabilities.

title: Solomon Islands leader defends possible China security deal, calls backlash 'very insulting'
description: The Prime Minister of the Solomon Islands on Tuesday defended the country's possible security deal with China, hitting back at critics and calling their protests "very insulting."

title: Gone in 90 seconds: The evolution of the airplane evacuation slide
description: "Arm doors and cross check."

title: 'These guys are really notorious': CNN military analyst on Wagner mercenaries in Ukraine
description: CNN's Don Lemon and Col. Cedric Leighton (Ret.) discuss reports that the Wagner Group -- made up of soldiers hired by Russia -- is now expected to be deployed in eastern Ukraine.

title: 'I don't care what he thinks': Biden pushes back on reporters over Putin remark
description: President Joe Biden said that he was not announcing a change in US policy when he said during a speech that Russian President Vladimir Putin "cannot remain in power."

title: Banned, censored, forced off the air: What Russian journalists covering Ukraine face
description: The Kremlin banned an interview with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky from airing in Russia. CNN's Matthew Chance talks to the journalists who conducted it.

title: Interview: Turkish spokesperson on sticking points in talks
description: The Turkish president's spokesperson, Ibrahim Kalin, speaks to CNN's Becky Anderson ahead of Ukraine and Russia's next round of in-person peace talks set to take place in Istanbul.
